=== Twitter Provider ===
'''Note: This provider is only available in Information Workbench Enterprise Edition.'''

==== Functionality ====

The TwitterProvider extracts public tweets of Twitter users. A Twitter user in the Information Workbench 
is represented by an URI located in the twitter namespace ''<nowiki>http://twitter.com/</nowiki>'' or ''twitter''. 
The TwitterProvider will automatically populate their wiki pages with their [[Help:Twitter | Twitter feed]] 
a [[Help:GMap | map showing their location ]] and further information like their followers for example.

Go back to [[Help:Providers | Providers ]]

==== Configuration Settings ====

{| class="wikitable" 
|-
! Parameter
! Description
! Required
|-
| twitterAccounts 
| Comma (",") separated list of twitter accounts. These are either given in the format "@twitterAccount" or if a corresponding foaf account is already in the local store in the form "foaf:foafId". 
| &#10004;
|-
| lifetime 
| The lifetime of the extracted data in hours 
| &#10004;
|}

==== Example ====

* Navigate to Admin:Providers and click on Add new provider, select 'Twitter Provider' from the dropdown menu.

<img src="../images/help/TwitterProvider-form.png" width="688px" />

* As with all providers, input a valid Identifier e.g. (myTwitterProvider) and Poll Interval e.g. 100.  
* Enter a (comma separated) list of valid twitter names in the twitterAccounts input area.
* Enter the life time of the data e.g. 100.
* Click 'Submit'
